settings.content:
Handsling carbon TT bikes are UCI-approved and fully personalised to your ride – finished with in-house paintwork at our UK factory. These dedicated speed machines are designed to help riders slice through the air in time trials – tested in race conditions and trusted by elite riders worldwide.

FREE PAINT - Order before 31st January to get free paint (applies to Handsling colour palette only).
Every Handsling bike is fully configurable. Select your model and groupset to start creating your dream bike.

Sized to You
settings.content: Remote Tailored Sizing sets your time trial position – stack height, extension reach and saddle height – so your TT bike arrives ready to race.

settings.title: Tailored to You
settings.content: Build the details that matter in time trial cycling: wheelset, gearing and finishing kit. Configured around your fit, custom painted in-house by our UK team, then assembled to your confirmed spec.

settings.title: Engineered for Performance
settings.content: UCI-approved aerodynamic bike frames with super-stiff carbon layup. Race-proven pedigree with multiple elite victories against the clock.

settings.title: Ride Experience
settings.content:
• Aerodynamic carbon TT frame with a sleek profile designed to reduce drag and convert power into speed.
  • Carbon lay-up optimises frame stiffness for efficient power transfer during time trial efforts.
  • Stable handling with the added confidence of disc brakes.
    Adjustable cockpit to set your optimum aero position.
  • Tyre clearance up to 32mm to reduce road buzz and maintain focus over imperfect surfaces.
  • Built for time trial cycling: sustained pace, confident control, and comfort that helps you save vital seconds.

settings.title: Manufacture
settings.content:
• Toray T800 carbon fibre frame, fork and cockpit: a high-performance material used in top level bikes.
  • Internal EPS moulding increases carbon compaction and removes inconsistencies – strong, light and stiff.
  • Carbon lay-up in the head tube, down tube, bottom bracket shell and chainstays create high rigidity for efficient power transfer.
  • Handsling owns the frame moulds and controls production, ensuring full production control of this aerodynamic bike frame.
  • Rigorous testing beyond ISO standards for long-term reliability.

settings.title: Design
settings.content:
• 100% in-house design with integrated hidden cables for aerodynamic efficiency.
  • Aero tube profiles engineered for real-world wind angles to cut drag consistently.
  • Clearance for 32mm tyres to balance race pace with ride comfort.
  • Short head tube enables a low, aggressive time-trial position.
  • Steep seat tube angle positions the rider further over the BB for pedalling efficiency.
  • Low-slung base bar and a fully adjustable cockpit for sustainable aero gains.
  • Designed to accommodate modern wireless electronic disc-brake groupsets.
  • BSA external threaded bottom bracket for serviceable reliability.
  • Built and fitted in Britain – perfect for riders looking for time trial bikes in the UK with local sizing support.

settings.title: Cockpit Adjustability
settings.content:
• Stem: 1.5cm fore/aft movement.
  • Spacer stack (pad stack): minimum 1cm above the base bar; maximum 8.5cm above the base bar.
  • Arm cups (pads): 3cm fore/aft movement and 4 cm lateral (side-to-side) movement.
  • Extensions: 7cm fore/aft movement; shortest reaches may require extensions to be cut.

These ranges let you tune elbow and hand position for sustainable time trial pacing.

settings.title: Bike customisation
settings.content:
• Choose your colour from a wide range of finishes and create a truly bespoke time trial bike.
  • Wheel options include rear disc and spoked wheels.
  • UK-assembled in Handsling’s factory to your size and specification.
  • Fully customised builds to suit your riding and budget (groupset, wheels, cockpit).
  • Remote Tailored Sizing included for an optimised fit.

settings.title: Customer service
settings.content:
• Customer service is Handsling’s overriding priority from first enquiry to long-term ownership.
  • Support goes beyond handover with ongoing technical advice on time trial setup, fit tweaks and upgrades.
  • A knowledgeable, UK-based team offers practical, rider-led guidance throughout your build.
  • Limited lifetime frame warranty for lasting confidence.

settings.title: The TSTRevo Carbon Time Trial Bike
settings.content:
Handsling has spent more than 12 months developing the TSTRevo, a dedicated carbon time trial bike with aerodynamically optimised tube profiles and a bespoke, fully adjustable carbon TT cockpit. The frame is UCI-approved, and its exceptional stiffness ensures rider power translates directly into speed – whether you’re targeting your club 10 mile TT or a long distance event.

We build each TSTRevo around your position through Remote Tailored Sizing – setting pad height/reach, extension length and saddle height – then assemble with your chosen groupset, wheels and finishing kit in the UK.

Your Fit. Your Spec. Your TSTRevo.

Ready to set a new personal best? Start with matching the bike to your position, finish with a race-ready TT bike.

settings.title: Ride Experience
settings.content:
Fast and confidence-inspiring, the A1R0evo makes you a quicker rider, responding when you put the power down, but still leaving you feeling fresh after a long ride.

The bike will do everything well, from storming tight city centre crits to conquering steep mountain passes, and floating over Belgian cobbles to cruising round the lanes.

settings.title: Performance
settings.content:
• Neutral geometry is stable and sure-footed
  • Truncated, D-shaped tube profiles are aero in a wide variety of conditions, no matter the wind direction
  • Integrated hidden cables provide a clean look and aerodynamic efficiency
  • Massively stiff headtube, downtube and bottom bracket shell, plus asymmetric forks and chainstays that resist twisting forces
  • Unique seattube design and clearance for high volume road tyres provides enhanced ride comfort

settings.title: Frame Design and Manufacture
settings.content:
• Designed 100% in-house and engineered by one of the best in the business
  • Handsling controls all aspects of production and owns the moulds used to manufacture the frames
  • Manufactured using Toray T800, one of the toughest performance carbons on the market
  • Internal EPS moulds result in increased carbon compaction to make the frame tougher, lighter and stiffer
  • Rigorous testing procedures surpass ISO standards

settings.title: Bike customisation
settings.content:
• 15 limited edition colours to add exclusivity
  • Bikes assembled in Handsling's UK workshop according to rider size and spec 
  • Fully customised build options enable the rider to tailor the bike to suit riding style and budget
  • Bikes are fitted with high-end components from Shimano, SRAM, and Campagnolo
  • Wide choice of wheel brands and rim depth
  • Handsling offers Remote Tailored Sizing to provide an opimised fit

settings.content:

  • Customer relationship goes beyond bike handover with ongoing support and technical advice

settings.title: Handsling TSTRevo
settings.content:
Designed by Handsling from scratch, the A1R0evo is stiff yet comfortable, lightweight yet robust, and highly versatile, with clearance for up to 32mm tyres.

The UCI-approved A1R0evo is available in six sizes and 15 limited edition colours.

settings.title: Short / Flat Course
settings.content:
Purpose: Optimum speed and aerodynamics

  • Drivetrain: 1x chainring and close ratio cassette for high torque and smooth gear changes 
  • Wheels: Rear disc and deep section spoked front for maximum aero gain
  • Tyres: 28mm to reduce weight

settings.title: Long / Hilly Course
settings.content:
Purpose: Balance speed, comfort and weight

  • Drivetrain: 2x chainring and wider ratio cassette for gear range on hills
  • Wheels: Shallower section wheels to reduce weight
  • Tyres: 30mm for greater comfort over long distance

settings.title: Stellar year for Handsling TSTRevo in elite time trial racing
settings.content: Race-proven just a year after launch – the Handsling TSTRevo time trial bike has powered Clube de Ciclismo de Tavira at UCI Continental level, taken 6th in the Volta a Portugal prologue, and carried Colin Tester to silver in the Island Games time trial in Orkney.

settings.title: Handsling TT Bikes Proven on the Clock
settings.content: Stories from elite athletes who race Handsling time trial bikes – how their customised builds translated to speed and confidence.

settings.title: Design Without Limits – 130+ Colour Combinations
settings.content: Keep the aero frame the hero while making it yours. Choose 130+ colour combinations; our UK team paints and finishes every frame on site, with crisp logos and durable paint for race-day polish and season-long durability.

settings.title: TT bike vs triathlon bike – what’s the difference and which should I pick?
settings.content: A TT bike is built for cycling time trials under UCI rules: a pure aerodynamic bike frame, adjustable TT cockpit (pads/extensions), and typically no on-frame storage. A triathlon bike is geared more to long-course comfort and often integrates storage/hydration. We designed the TSTRevo so it can be set up for either TT or triathlon, making it a highly versatile choice to cover both disciplines.

settings.title: What are the benefits of carbon time trial bikes vs aluminium?
settings.content:
Short answer: carbon gives you better stiffness-to-weight, and improved vibration damping – so it’s easier to hold a fast time trial position for longer.

  • Aero shaping freedom: Carbon can be moulded into smoother, deeper profiles and cleaner junctions than most alloy designs – reducing drag on a dedicated aerodynamic bike frame.
  • Stiffness-to-weight: Targeted carbon lay-ups add torsional stiffness at the head tube/BB without unnecessary mass, helping more of your effort become speed.
  • Ride feel you can hold: Carbon damps road buzz better than alloy, making it easier to stay low on the pads and maintain pace.
  • Integration & routing: Carbon construction supports tidy internal runs and integrated solutions that keep the airflow clean.

If outright aero efficiency and efficient power transfer are your goals, carbon TT bikes are the best choice. We’ll confirm the best route during Remote Tailored Sizing and UK-assemble the build to your spec.

settings.title: What is the ideal time trial bike fit?
settings.content: There isn’t one “ideal” fit – there’s a sustainable aero position you can hold. Key principles: set pad stack/reach so you’re compact yet breathing freely; match extension length/tilt to keep the head steady; place the saddle so hip angle stays open for power. We determine this via Remote Tailored Sizing, then fine-tune on the adjustable cockpit (pads fore/aft & lateral, stack spacers, extension reach) before assembling in our Hampshire, UK factory.

settings.title: Are TT bikes heavier than road bikes?
settings.content: Often slightly, yes. A TT bike may weigh more than a carbon road bike due to added carbon layup, the TT cockpit and deeper wheels, but it’s typically faster on flat/rolling courses because reduced aerodynamic drag outweighs small mass differences. For climbs or technical routes, wheel/tyre choices and fit can be tuned to balance handling and speed.

settings.title: What’s the usual lead time for a custom TT bike build?
settings.content: A Handsling custom time trial bike will typically take 4-6 weeks, depending on paint choice and component availability. If you have an event deadline, we’ll advise in-stock options and confirm a build slot before we start assembly.

settings.title: Do you offer carbon TT framesets-only so I can move parts across?
settings.content: Yes – TT frameset-only options are available (subject to current stock). We’ll check compatibility for your groupset, brakes, wheels and cockpit before you transfer parts.

settings.title: Do you offer fittings in the UK?
settings.content: Yes. Come to our Hampshire HQ or complete Remote Tailored Sizing online. We’ll set your TT position, agree frame size and cockpit set up then proceed to assembly. To arrange, email sales@handslingbikes.com or call 01420 612700.
